_header: God that is mightful / Speed all rightful
Versification: — two-line, three-line, four line, five-line — aa, aaa, aaaa, aaaaa
Bibliographic Ghosts: London, British Library Egerton 3245 [olim Gurney]: includes only six lines as part of 2871.
_description: A simple prayer in monorhyming lines; length varies

BodAsh189.Transcription:
God þat þat [sic] ys myghtfullSpede All
                    ryghtfullHelpe All nedefullHaue mercy ouer all synfull
BodAsh189.Editions:
Black,  William Henry. 
             Catalogi Codicum Manuscriptorum Bibliothecae Bodleianae…Pars X,
                A…Catalogue of the Manuscripts bequeathed…by Elias Ashmole.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1845: 152.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Popular Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         36 (1939): 337-50: 338, 342-3.

OxfCCC237.Transcription:
god allmyghtie Rewe all wylfullComfort all CarefullAnd have
                    mercye of all synfull
OxfCCC237.Note:
Three lines; listed as separate in Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr.,  William A. 
             Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript
                1501-1558.
         London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by 
                Michael
                Rudick
             and 
                Susan J.
                Ringler
            , TM
                    477.
OxfCCC237.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Popular Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         36 (1939): 337-50: 338, 342-3.

CULDd82.Transcription:
Lorde that ys al myghtfullespede al RightfulleHelpe al
                    nedefullecomforte al syke and sorovfulleAnd haue mercy on al
                    synnefulle AmenAnd for al that be quyke and deede Sey a pater noster a
                    ave and a crede
CULDd82.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Popular Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         36 (1939): 337-50: 338, 342-3.

NLWLan164.Editions:
Historical Manuscripts Commission, Report on Manuscripts in the Welsh
                Language.
         2 vols. in 7 (1898-1910) [numbered 48 in Guide]: 2.753.

HunHM903.Transcription:
God almyghtfull saue al RightffullWys alle Willeffull help all
                    NedfullGladde alle sorufull haf mercy Of alle Synnefull
HunHM903.Editions:
Laird,  Charlton. 
             “A Fourteenth Century Scribe.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         55 (1940): 601-3: 603, n. 5.
Dutschke,  C. W. 
             Guide to Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts in the Huntington
                Library.
         2 vols. San Marino, CA: Huntington Library, 1989: 1.261.
